question.questionA: Corolla deeply five-lobed almost to the base.
question.questionB: Corolla campanulate or conical, lobes usually less than half the length of the tube.

question.questionA: Leaves  rough-hairy,  oblong,  margins  undulate; flowers violate or reddish purple; calyx lobes undulate,  ascending,  twice  as  long as corolla lobes.
question.questionB: Leaves glabrous, obovate, margins entire; flowers violet; calyx lobes linear, recurved, three times as long as corolla lobes.

question.questionA: Perennials; leaves oblong, margins sinuous; flowers pink and white.
question.questionB: Annuals; leaves ovate, entire; flowers blue and white.
Corolla campanulate or conical, lobes more or less erect.
